variants.Description in input context: This variant causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function.

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line, cultured under standard conditions (37Â°C, 5% CO2).

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was reduced by approximately 50% on day 7 after transfection of HEK293 cells with the mutant construct. Control cells transfected with wild-type TP53 showed normal protein levels.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed, each using a new batch of HEK293 cells.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate on the Western blot membrane to ensure technical reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Description: HEK293 cells transfected with a plasmid containing wild-type TP53 cDNA served as a positive control to confirm antibody specificity and overall assay performance.

Basic negative control.Description: HEK293 cells transfected with an empty vector plasmid (no TP53 insert) served as a negative control to rule out background signal.

Validation controls P/LP.Description: Two previously validated pathogenic TP53 variants (c.XXX>Y and c.ZZZ>W) were included as positive validation controls.

Validation controls B/LB.Description: One previously validated benign TP53 variant (c.AAA>BBB) was included as a negative validation control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by Tukey's post-hoc test was used to determine statistical significance between experimental groups.  p < 0.05 was considered statistically significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression level between 80% and 120% of the control group on day 7.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression level less than 80% or greater than 120% of the control group on day 7.

Approved assay.Description: Western blot analysis for TP53 protein expression is a standard assay used in research and diagnostic settings to assess TP53 function.
